dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1819 IS: Defending Our Government’s Electronic Data: Bolstering Responsible Oversight and Safeguards Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Warner (for himself, Ms. Alsobrooks, Mr. Kaine, Mr. Luján, Mr. Schiff, Mr. Van Hollen, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To increase the penalties for various violations of Federal law.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defending Our Government’s Electronic Data: Bolstering Responsible Oversight and Safeguards Act or the DOGE BROS Act.
Section 552a(i) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking $5,000 and inserting $30,000;
in paragraph (2), by striking $5,000 and inserting $30,000; and
in paragraph (3), by striking $5,000 and inserting $30,000.

section.header: Obtainment of information from any department or agency of the United States using a computer without authorization
section.text: Section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking (2)(A) except as provided in subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:
except as provided in subparagraphs (B) and (C)
in subparagraphs (B) and (C), by moving the margins 2 ems to the right; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Higher maximum fine for individuals who obtain information from United States departments or agencies
subsection.text: In the case of an offense under subsection (a)(2)(B) committed by an individual, subsection (c)(2) shall be applied by substituting a fine of not more than $750,000 for a fine under this title each place it appears.

section.header: Increase in fines for unauthorized disclosures of information held by Social Security Administration or Department of Health and Human Services
section.text: Section 1106(a)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1306(a)(1)) is amended by striking $10,000 and inserting $25,000.

section.header: Increase in fines for unauthorized disclosures of taxpayer information
section.text: Paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (4), and (5) of section 7213(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are each amended by striking $5,000 each place it appears and inserting $25,000.
Section 214 of title 13, United States Code, is amended by striking $5,000 and inserting $25,000.
